item.title: After Active Duty: The Importance of Mentorship
item.description:
After Active Duty: The Importance of Mentorship

When asked about the highlight of his career, retired Brig. Gen. Kevin Nally, USMC, could provide a lot of different answers. The highlight, in his eyes, was mentoring young Marines and "passing on my knowledge and what I've learned from others so that they don't make the same mistakes and have the chance and the resources to succeed."

item.title: Tony Robbins shares the best career advice he's ever been given
item.description:
Tony Robbins shares the best career advice he's ever been given

Tony Robbins grew up in a poor and unstable family. He was on his own at 17, living on a janitor's income. After saving up for one of the late motivational speaker Jim Rohn's seminars, he approached Rohn for a job. Rohn became a mentor to Robbins, who eventually became a speaker.

item.title: How to Follow Up After Meeting Someone in Person | The Art of Manliness
item.description:
How to Follow Up After Meeting Someone in Person | The Art of Manliness

Editor's Note: This a guest post by John Corcoran. Last year, AoM published a thorough guide on How to Network Effectively, written by Antonio. As he always does, Antonio crafted the definitive resource for how to prepare for and execute a night of networking and socializing.

item.title: Amway Malnutrition Efforts Featured in USCCF Healthy Returns Report
item.description:
Amway Malnutrition Efforts Featured in USCCF Healthy Returns Report

The U.S. Chamber of Commerce Foundation recognized Amway and several other companies and organizations this month for their efforts to address community health. The Chamber's Corporate Citizenship Center recently released " Healthy Returns: The Value of Investing in Community Health," a collection of case studies exemplifying the newest and most advanced ways that organizations are tackling the issue.

item.title: Two Inboxes: Bhargavi Arrunategui from LexisNexis and Cinderella Bridez
item.description:
Two Inboxes: Bhargavi Arrunategui from LexisNexis and Cinderella Bridez

In episode 11 of Two Inboxes (listen on iTunes here), I interviewed Bhargavi Arrunategui. Arrunategui is a Solutions Consultant at LexisNexis. Outside of this full-time role, Bhargavi is also the founder of Cinderella Bridez, a wedding beauty business that focuses on South Asian weddings, and also works as an Amway Independent Business Owner helping other people start [...]

item.title: Goodbye Freedom 55: How about 66 or 70?
item.description:
Goodbye Freedom 55: How about 66 or 70?

At 76, thoroughbred horse trainer Roger Attfield has no interest in retiring. "There's an old saying that racehorse trainers don't retire, they just die," said Attfield with a laugh. 'Racehorse trainers don't retire, they just die.'

item.title: How and why Amway's DeVos family gives away billions
item.description:
How and why Amway's DeVos family gives away billions

GRAND RAPIDS, MI - Years ago, a Grand Rapids business owner was greeted by Rich DeVos with an expensive compliment. "You look like a million dollars," the Amway co-founder, Orlando Magic owner and Grand Rapids billionaire told Leslie Tassell, founder of autoparts maker Lescoa.

item.title: Amway gives Stanford University $10 million for first-of-its-kind study on health
item.description:
Amway gives Stanford University $10 million for first-of-its-kind study on health

ADA, MI - Stanford University will undertake a first-of-its kind study to track how everything from exercising to eating fresh produce can lengthen a human lifespan. Amway is picking up tab. The Ada-based direct sales giant is donating $10 million for the new Stanford project, WELL, short for Wellness Living Laboratory, which will launch next year.
